name: biomni-simulate-microbial-population-dynamics
title: Biomni: Simulate Microbial Population Dynamics
description: Simulate microbial population dynamics with multiple interacting species
content:
Overview

Simulates microbial population dynamics for multiple interacting species using flexible mathematical models that can incorporate diverse ecological interactions, resource competition, cross-feeding, and environmental factors. This tool provides a customizable framework for modeling complex microbial communities with species-specific parameters and interaction networks, enabling hypothesis testing and predictive modeling of community behavior.

Input Parameters

  • species_params (required): Dictionary containing species-specific parameters including growth rates, death rates, carrying capacities, and metabolic characteristics
  • interactions (required): Detailed specification of ecological interactions between species (competition, mutualism, predation, commensalism, parasitism)
  • simulation_time (optional, default: 100): Total simulation duration in hours
  • time_step (optional, default: 0.1): Integration time step for numerical solver in hours

Input Format

{
  "species_params": {
    "species1": {"initial_pop": 1e6, "growth_rate": 0.5, "death_rate": 0.05, "K": 1e9},
    "species2": {"initial_pop": 5e5, "growth_rate": 0.3, "death_rate": 0.03, "K": 5e8}
  },
  "interactions": {
    "species1_species2": {"type": "competition", "strength": -0.001},
    "species2_species1": {"type": "competition", "strength": -0.0008}
  },
  "simulation_time": 150,
  "time_step": 0.1
}

Biological Use Case

Versatile tool for microbiology and ecology research including:

  • Modeling microbiome dynamics under perturbations (antibiotics, diet changes)
  • Designing and optimizing synthetic microbial consortia for bioproduction
  • Investigating invasibility and colonization resistance in microbial communities
  • Predicting responses to environmental stressors and climate change
  • Analyzing food web dynamics in microbial ecosystems
  • Engineering stable probiotic communities for therapeutic applications
  • Studying evolutionary dynamics and adaptation in microbial populations

Output

Provides detailed population dynamics analysis including:

  • Population trajectories for all species over time
  • Community composition dynamics and succession patterns
  • Resource utilization profiles (if modeled)
  • Species dominance shifts and transitions
  • Community stability metrics and resilience indicators
  • Interaction network effects on population dynamics
  • Comprehensive simulation summary (population_dynamics_results.txt)

Category

microbiology
